title: How to Make Aubergines Gratinees

steps.headline: In a saucepan melt butter over medium heat.

steps.headline: Preheat oven to 350 °F (177 °C).
steps.description: Using paper towels, dry the aubergine slices and coat with the flour.

steps.headline: In a large skillet, heat half the vegetable oil over a medium-high heat.
steps.description: When the oil is hot add the aubergine slices one at a time. Fry, turn occasionally using tongs, until they are brown to dark brown in color. #Remove and drain on paper towels. Keep the draining slices hot while frying the remaining slices. If you need more oil add it.

steps.headline: Pour a layer of the sauce into an ovenproof casserole.
steps.description: Sprinkle some of the cheese on top, and then add a layer of the aubergine. Continue adding a layer of sauce, cheese and aubergine until all ingredients have been used up. Make sure you top off the final layer of aubergine with sauce. #Sprinkle the remaining Parmesan cheese and all the breadcrumbs over the sauce and dot with the small pieces of butter.

steps.headline: Bake for 25 minutes or until a golden brown.

text:
In a saucepan melt butter over medium heat. When foam subsides add onion and cook 5 minutes or until translucent and soft. Stir in the flour and cook 1 minute. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/6a/Make-Aubergines-Gratinees-Step-1Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Make-Aubergines-Gratinees-Step-1Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/6a/Make-Aubergines-Gratinees-Step-1Bullet1.jpg/v4-760px-Make-Aubergines-Gratinees-Step-1Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use (screenshot)

"} After straining the liquid from the canned tomatoes pour into saucepan with the onions. Stir. Add tomato puree, basil, salt and pepper. Bring mixture to a boil stirring continuously. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/9c/Make-Aubergines-Gratinees-Step-2Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Make-Aubergines-Gratinees-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/9c/Make-Aubergines-Gratinees-Step-2Bullet1.jpg/v4-760px-Make-Aubergines-Gratinees-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use (screenshot)

"} Reduce heat to low, cover and simmer 15 minutes. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f7/Make-Aubergines-Gratinees-Step-2Bullet2.jpg/v4-460px-Make-Aubergines-Gratinees-Step-2Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f7/Make-Aubergines-Gratinees-Step-2Bullet2.jpg/v4-760px-Make-Aubergines-Gratinees-Step-2Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use (screenshot)

"} Preheat oven to 350 °F (177 °C). Using paper towels, dry the aubergine slices and coat with the flour. In a large skillet, heat half the vegetable oil over a medium-high heat. When the oil is hot add the aubergine slices one at a time. Fry, turn occasionally using tongs, until they are brown to dark brown in color. #Remove and drain on paper towels. Keep the draining slices hot while frying the remaining slices. If you need more oil add it. Pour a layer of the sauce into an ovenproof casserole. Sprinkle some of the cheese on top, and then add a layer of the aubergine. Continue adding a layer of sauce, cheese and aubergine until all ingredients have been used up. Make sure you top off the final layer of aubergine with sauce. #Sprinkle the remaining Parmesan cheese and all the breadcrumbs over the sauce and dot with the small pieces of butter. Bake for 25 minutes or until a golden brown. Serve immediately. Finished.
